Subjective: Left eye irritation since Tuesday morning. Redness, foreign body sensation. No vision changes or photophobia. No trauma, chemicals, or contact lens use. No systemic symptoms. No fever, cough, or shortness of breath. No prior eye issues. Social: Single mother, boyfriend away. Concern: Worried about contagion, impact on daughter. Request: Advice on treatment and reassurance.
Objective: Left eye: conjunctival injection without discharge. Right eye: mild injection. Pupils reactive, no corneal defects. No foreign body on exam.
Assessment: Viral conjunctivitis. No signs of bacterial infection or corneal injury.
Plan: 1. Artificial tears as needed for comfort. 2. Warm water compresses. 3. Advise no rubbing. 4. Safety net: Return if no improvement in 2 weeks, increased pain, or vision changes. 5. Follow-up in 2 weeks if needed.
